name: Best Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'picante sauce'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Heat oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes.. Add rice; cook and stir until rice begins to turn golden brown.. Stir in chicken broth and picante sauce.. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until liquid has been absorbed, about 15 to 20 minutes.

name: Instant Pot Mexican Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'avocado oil, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'long-grain rice'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'low-sodium chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}
steps: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot); select sauté function and adjust to medium.. Cover the bottom of the pot with avocado oil. Cook and stir onion until soft, 4 to 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.. Add rice to the pot; mix until coated with oil and lightly browned. Pour in chicken stock; stir any browned bits off the bottom of the pot.. Pour in chicken stock; stir any browned bits off the bottom of the pot.. Mix in tomato sauce, salt, cumin, and cayenne pepper.. Close and lock the lid. Seal the vent and select high-pressure function. Set a timer for 7 minutes; allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to the manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Stir rice before serving.

name: Flavorful Spanish Rice and Beans
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'sweet onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1.41 ounce) package', 'name': 'sazon seasoning'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'adobo seasoning'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'red beans, drained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(2.25 ounce) can', 'name': 'pitted green olives (Optional)'}
steps: Bring water, rice, and olive oil to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Mix in onion, Sazón seasoning, adobo seasoning, garlic, and black pepper. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and cook for 10 minutes.. Add beans and olives and cook until liquid has been absorbed, about 10 minutes. Mix before serving.

name: Spanish Rice II
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes and green chiles'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chili powder, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Heat oil in a deep skillet over medium heat. Saute rice, onion, and bell pepper until rice is browned and onions are tender.. Stir in water and tomatoes. Season with chili powder and salt. Cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, or until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed.

name: Arroz Rojo (Mexican Red Rice)
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Roma (plum tomatoes), cored'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked long-grain white rice'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'low-sodium chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'canned tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}
steps: Grate tomatoes into a bowl using a box grater; discard tomato skins.. Heat vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.. Stir in rice and cook, stirring often, until rice is lightly toasted, about 3 more minutes. Stir in grated tomato, chicken broth, and tomato sauce; bring mixture to a boil.. Stir in jalapeño pepper, cilantro, and salt; reduce heat to low. Cover the skillet and simmer until liquid has been absorbed, about 15 minutes. Do not lift the cover while rice is cooking.. Turn off the heat; let rice stand, covered, for 8 minutes. Fluff with a fork before transferring rice to a serving dish.

name: Quick and Easy Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked instant rice (such as Minute®)'}, {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable juice (such as V8®)'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'taco seasoning'}
steps: Cook and stir onion, garlic, and vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat until onions are softened, about 5 minutes.. Stir rice into onion mixture and cook, stirring often, until rice becomes slightly opaque, 1 to 2 minutes.. Stir chicken broth, vegetable juice, and taco seasoning into rice mixture and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat until rice has absorbed most of the liquid, about 5 minutes.

name: Arroz Rojo
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lard or peanut oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'long grain white rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Heat the lard in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add the rice, and stir until rice is toasted. Add the garlic and onion; cook and stir until the onion just begins to brown. Stir in the tomatoes, tomato sauce, chicken broth, chili powder and salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 20 to 25 minutes, or until rice is tender. Let stand for 5 minutes, covered, before serving.

name: Rice Cooker Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'canned corn, drained (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled cooked bacon (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped black olives (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'salsa'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cumin'}
steps: Combine tomatoes, rice, tomato sauce, chicken broth, corn, bacon, onion, red bell pepper, olives, salsa, and chili powder in a rice cooker. Seal the cooker and select rice setting according to manufacturer's instructions; cook until tender, 20 to 25 minutes.

name: Better Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked instant rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth'}
steps: Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat, and cook and stir the chopped onion until browned, about 8 minutes.. Stir in the rice, tomatoes, cilantro, and chicken broth, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer until the rice is cooked and most of the liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes.

name: Spicy Spanish-Style Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked long-grain white rice'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced jalapeno pepper'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili powder, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chipotle chile powder, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}
steps: Melt butter in a pot over medium-low heat. Stir rice, jalapeno, green onion, and garlic together in the melted butter until rice is completely coated with butter. Add chili powder, cumin, salt, chipotle chile powder, and cayenne pepper; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute.. Stir chicken stock and tomato sauce into rice mixture. Bring to a simmer, cover the pot, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 20 minutes. Turn heat off and leave pot covered on the burner for 8 minutes. Remove cover and fluff rice with a fork.

name: Spanish Brown Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'salsa'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}
steps: Combine rice and garlic in a saucepan. Stir in water, salsa, and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil.. Stir rice mixture and reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 50 minutes. Turn off heat and allow rice to sit, covered, for an additional 5 to 10 minutes. Stir rice before serving.

name: Easy Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'long-grain rice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'tomato bouillon with chicken flavoring (such as Knorr®), or more to taste'}
steps: Place a pot over medium-heat heat; add oil and heat until oil shimmers slightly. Pour rice into hot oil, stirring constantly, until rice is golden to dark brown, about 5 minutes.. Mix water, tomatoes, onion, cilantro, and bouillon into rice. Bring to a boil, then turn off heat. Cover the pot tightly with a lid and let sit until liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Adjust seasonings as needed.

name: Quick Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onions'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped celery'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes with juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'beef bouillon granules'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "cooked white rice (such as Uncle Ben's®)"}
steps: Heat butter in a frying pan over medium heat; cook and stir onion, green bell pepper, celery, and garlic until slightly tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir tomatoes with juice, chili powder, beef bouillon granules, and salt into onion mixture; add rice. Simmer rice mixture, stirring occasionally, until heated through and flavors are blended, 15 to 20 minutes.

name: Easy Arroz con Gandules
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell peppers, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(.25 ounce) package', 'name': 'Spanish seasoning'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked brown rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'pigeon peas, drained'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'boiling water'}
steps: Place green peppers, onion, garlic and cilantro in a blender or food processor, puree. This mixture is called soffrito, it is your seasoning base. It can be stored in an airtight container and refrigerated for up to 2 weeks or frozen for up to 6 months.. Place 3 tablespoons olive oil and 6 tablespoons soffrito in an 8 quart saucepan. Cook for 3 or 4 minutes to release oils.. Pour one can of tomato sauce and the Spanish seasoning packet into the saucepan, mix well. Add 3 cups rice to the mixture and stir until the rice is coated.. Stir pigeon peas into the mixture and add boiling water. Cover the pot with aluminum foil and a pot lid. Reduce heat to simmer and cook 45 minutes or until rice is tender.

name: Easy Authentic Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalapeño peppers, chopped (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'name': 'Mexican-style diced tomatoes, undrained'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water, or as needed to cover (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream, or as desired (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese, or as desired (Optional)'}
steps: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir onions and jalapeño peppers in butter until softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir Mexican-style tomatoes into onion mixture; add rice, salt, and black pepper. Add just enough water to cover rice.. Bring rice mixture to a boil, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is cooked, 40 to 45 minutes. Garnish with sour cream and Cheddar cheese to serve.

name: Spanish Rice Original
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'bacon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'onions, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'green bell peppers, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10 ounce) can', 'name': 'sliced black olives, drained (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10 ounce) can', 'name': 'whole kernel corn, drained (Optional)'}
steps: Bring chicken broth and tomato sauce to a boil in a small saucepan, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and maintain a simmer while preparing the remaining ingredients.. Meanwhile, place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate, reserving bacon grease in the skillet. Chop bacon.. Cook and stir onion in reserved bacon grease over medium heat until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in rice; cook and stir until lightly browned, 3 to 5 minutes. Pour boiling chicken broth and tomato sauce into rice mixture; add diced tomatoes, green peppers, and chopped bacon. Season with chili powder, salt, and pepper.. Cover and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, 30 to 40 minutes. Stir black olives and corn into rice mixture before serving.

name: Slow Cooker Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'ground beef or chuck'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'whole peeled tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell peppers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked converted rice'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}
steps: Place ground beef in a large skillet. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Transfer beef to a slow cooker.. Combine tomatoes, green pepper, water, tomato sauce, onions, rice, salt, chili powder, and Worcestershire sauce in the slow cooker. Stir thoroughly.. Cover and cook until rice is tender, on Low for 6 to 8 hours or High for 3 to 5 hours.

name: Vegan Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked brown rice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'crushed garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(10 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Heat oil in a deep skillet over medium heat. Add rice, bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Cook and stir until rice is browned and onion is tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in water and diced tomatoes. Season with chili powder and salt. Cover and simmer until rice is cooked, about 30 minutes.

name: Brown Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes with green chile peppers'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'name': 'chicken broth'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown rice'}
steps: Bring diced tomatoes, chicken broth, and salt to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add rice. Cover, reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer until rice is cooked and liquid is absorbed, about 1 hour. Stir before serving.

name: Keto Cauliflower Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'name': 'frozen riced cauliflower'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'granulated garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground white pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chunky salsa'}
steps: Put cauliflower rice in a microwaveable bowl. Add about 2 tablespoons water. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave on high until tender, about 5 minutes. Let cool until safe to handle.. Lay a thin dish towel on a flat surface. Add 1/2 of cauliflower. Hold the 4 corners of the towel together to wrap up cauliflower completely. Twist the towel and squeeze hard to drain off as much water as possible. Remove cauliflower and repeat with other half.. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until smoking. Add cauliflower, onion, garlic, chili powder, cumin, and white pepper. Sauté, stirring constantly until cauliflower is browned and liquid is evaporated, about 5 minutes. Add salsa. Cook and stir until salsa is mostly reduced, 8 to 10 minutes more.

name: Baked Mexican Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "parboiled rice (such as Uncle Ben's®)"}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'canola oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'green onions, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(.18 ounce) packet', 'name': 'sazon seasoning with saffron (such as Goya® Azafran) (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground coriander'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, cut into wedges'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).. Place rice in a 9-inch square baking dish. Drizzle in canola oil; stir to coat rice completely. Stir in green pepper, onion, and green onions. Season with sazon seasoning, cumin, garlic powder, coriander, and salt.. Combine water and tomato sauce in a microwave-safe bowl or measuring cup. Heat until simmering, about 2 minutes. Pour over the rice and stir briefly. Cover the baking dish tightly with heavy-duty aluminum foil.. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork. Stir in cilantro and squeeze lime juice over the top.

name: Simple Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'instant rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(11 ounce) can', 'name': 'vegetable juice (such as V8)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add rice, onion, and bell pepper; cook and stir until vegetables are slightly tender and rice is lightly browned, 7 to 10 minutes.. Stir in diced tomatoes, vegetable juice, tomato sauce, water, sugar, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper; bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes more.

name: Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked long-grain white rice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'stewed tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}
steps: In a large skillet, combine oil, rice, onion, green pepper and salt and pepper until the rice is a light brown color. Remove skillet from stove.. Mix tomatoes into the mixture. Pour in water (it should cover the entire mixture; use more if necessary). Return the skillet to the stovetop and bring the mixture to a full boil; salt and pepper to taste. When the mixture begins to boil, cover the skillet, and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook 12 to 15 minutes and never, I mean NEVER, remove the cover. After 12 to 15 minutes, turn stove off and let stand for another 12 to 15 minutes. DO NOT remove cover until the final 15 minutes has elapsed!

name: Linnie's Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) jar', 'name': 'salsa'}
steps: Combine the rice with the garlic in a large saucepan. Pour water and salsa into the rice mixture. Bring the water to a full boil and then reduce the temperature to simmer. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the rice is tender. Fluff the rice when finished.

name: Easy Slow Cooker Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(28 ounce) can', 'name': 'whole peeled tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(8 ounce) cans', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell peppers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'converted raw rice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chili powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'hot sauce, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste'}
steps: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until lightly browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard fat.. Transfer beef to a slow cooker. Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, green bell peppers, water, onions, rice, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, and hot sauce. Cook on High until rice is tender, about 3 hours. Serve in bowls and top with Cheddar cheese.

name: Spicy American Spanish Rice
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'long-grain converted rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'name': 'diced tomatoes with green chilies (such as RO*TEL®)'}
steps: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir rice in the melted butter until rice is lightly browned, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir bell pepper and onion into rice and cook until bell pepper is softened and onion is translucent, 5 to 8 minutes.. Break the ground beef into the rice mixture; cook and stir until beef is completely browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Stir tomato sauce and diced tomatoes into ground beef mixture. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
